page.title: 01Glen Iorsa and Hills
page.content: Glen Iorsa is the main physical feature of this area. It is a very remote glen and nobody lives or works here. However, it is popular with hillwalkers, and there is a well-defined footpath running alongside Iorsa water. The valley floor is extremely boggy, and there are a few small lochans very close to the burn itself. The area is a site of Special Scientific interest, and the majority of it is owned by the Dougarie Estate. A small part of the eastern section is owned by the National Trust for Scotland - their boundary follows the Parish boundary along the high ridges here. The highest land here is Beinn Tarsuinn at 825 mts, and a district footpath runs along the ridges of Beinn Nuis and Beinn Tarsuinn.
